svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 9, 2017" date: "2017-07-09"
* Laura Shin’s cryptobubble article put Olaf Carlson-Wee on the cover of Forbes … and
Laura Shin’s cryptobubble article put Olaf Carlson-Wee on the cover of Forbes … and
* ETH Gas Station – what’s new in version 2.0
ETH Gas Station – what’s new in version 2.0
* Tons of phishing attacks the past week or so – mainly fake MyEtherWallet sites
spammed through Slack, but hardly limited to MEW. Don’t click links . The phisher
Tons of phishing attacks the past week or so – mainly fake MyEtherWallet sites spammed
through Slack, but hardly limited to MEW. Don’t click links .
* Zug is giving all residents a uPort identity Great example of the Jurisdictional
Competition post from Fred Wilson. That post came out of this series of Jason
Calcanis and Fred tweets Exhibit B: Mauritius is recruiting ConsenSys to turn the
Zug is giving all residents a uPort identity
* Great example of the Jurisdictional Competition post from Fred Wilson. That post
came out of this series of Jason Calcanis and Fred tweets
Great example of the Jurisdictional Competition post from Fred Wilson. That post came
out of this series of Jason Calcanis and Fred tweets
* Exhibit B: Mauritius is recruiting ConsenSys to turn the island into a blockchain
Exhibit B: Mauritius is recruiting ConsenSys to turn the island into a blockchain hub
* Vitalik Reddit comments rehashing what currently sucks about Ethereum and technical
* Securify : a web interface tool for formal verification of Solidity and bytecode.
Securify : a web interface tool for formal verification of Solidity and bytecode. Also
* Ox.js : “hook into…contracts from a client-side web application”
Ox.js : “hook into…contracts from a client-side web application”
* A practical guide to cheap IPFS hash storage in an Ethereum smart contract
A practical guide to cheap IPFS hash storage in an Ethereum smart contract
* Part 3 of Daniel Ellison’s series on LLL
Part 3 of Daniel Ellison’s series on LLL
* Writing Smart Contracts With Truffle - a guide for devs new to Ethereum Also Dick
Writing Smart Contracts With Truffle - a guide for devs new to Ethereum
* Bug bounty leaderboard #1 Martin Holst Swende analysis on how miners can frontrun
Bancor contracts. Here’s an ELI5: don’t use market orders.
Bug bounty leaderboard #1 Martin Holst Swende analysis on how miners can frontrun
* Solidity 0.4.13 , a bug fix for this week’s v0.4.12 ‘throw’ is deprecated
Solidity 0.4.13 , a bug fix for this week’s v0.4.12
* How much it costs in gas to bet on each of the Ethereum gaming sites
How much it costs in gas to bet on each of the Ethereum gaming sites
* Blockchain for Social Impact Coalition to help non-profits figure out how Ethereum
Blockchain for Social Impact Coalition to help non-profits figure out how Ethereum can
* RAC is releasing an album through Ujo Music . It’s only been about 6 weeks since
RAC is releasing an album through Ujo Music . It’s only been about 6 weeks since RAC’s
* Tokenize Wikipedia . See also Curation Markets whitepaper
Tokenize Wikipedia . See also Curation Markets whitepaper
* A list of the week’s new projects added to Ether Casts
A list of the week’s new projects added to Ether Casts
* Stephan Tual on PolkaDot Gavin Wood talks PolkaDot at Eth London meetup
* Gavin Wood talks PolkaDot at Eth London meetup
* Is frictionless Ethereum and dapp usage possible?
Is frictionless Ethereum and dapp usage possible?
* Grid+ whitepaper is out. If that link goes down, try their website .
* Mattereum - Vinay Gupta white paper on legally enforceable smart contracts
* First Blood locks up tokens for founders until “wide” adoption
* Colony’s Jack du Rose & Aron Fischer podcast chat with Aaron Watson
* Jordi Baylina and Griff Green talk Metropolis on Youtube
* Tyler Smith on the EnergyMakers podcast
* A quick look at the Santiment token sale distribution
* DA Power Play : digital asset trading automation
* Coinfund’s Alex Bulkin: The biggest cryptoasset by marketcap within 5 years will be
* Mougayar: Token sale funding exceeds VC funding .
* Zeppelin unveils Coral: a standardized ERC20 token fundraising platform
* Vitalik humorously responds to the litany of Bitcoin maximalist objections
* Sunny Aggarwal and Nate Rush with an ELI20 for Tezos
* Speculative, but: what’s driving EOS demand
* How I bought and setup my ENS name
* IRS narrows the extent of its Coinbase fishing expedition
* Paul Vigna covers token sales in the WSJ
* Thinking about locked up ether when modeling demand for ETH
You can find this calendar updated daily at TokenSaleCalendar.com
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as
to even whether they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether
any will produce a satisfactory return. I have passed the CFA exams , but this is not
investment advice. If you’re interested in what I do, you can find mysomewhat
out-of-date investing thesis and token sale appreciation strategies in previous
Some time in early August, there will be an announcement that I’ve joined ConsenSys.
Here’s a logo to draw your eye in case you were going to skip over this section:
I’m very excited about this move and will have significantly more to say in the
future. The newsletters should become more regular again! In the meantime, I wanted
to make it clear so that you can judge whether I favor ConsenSys projects.
My charge from Joe Lubin is pretty similar to what Status has told me: keep telling
the truth and covering the space objectively, even if the truth hurts.
The best compliment you can give this is to share or upvote:
This newsletter is supported by Status.im . But in case you still want to send Ether
